title: 4-year-old accidentally shoots himself, father charged
content:
NORFOLK, Va. (WVEC) --Bond was denied Tuesday for a Norfolk father who faces two felony charges after his young son accidentally shot himself with a gun Saturday.
Bradley Shines told detectives that his 4-year-old son found a gun in his bedroom and the child accidentally shot himself.
The incident occurred around 11 a.m. in the 400 block of West 27th Street in Newport News.
The boy was transported to the hospital and is expected to recover.
Shines is charged with one count each of felony child neglect and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Shines is scheduled for a preliminary hearing on March 21.
No further information was released.
